poem:
### Digital Indifference

In the pixelated realm of virtual stars,  
I reign victorious, a digital deity,  
yet the universe replies  
with a yellow thumb—  
a twinge of apathy  
dancing on my screen,  
whispering irrelevance  
in this scroll of life.  
Here, winning feels like  
a secret folded inside  
the unsent letter of a phone.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "My petty gripe: Thumbs-up emojis say ‘I don’t care’ – please stop using them on my big news I just beat all of my friends at the new Mario Party game. It wasn’t even close. There are luck elements in the game, sure, but I got about a million stars and they got none. I feel like a god walking among mortals. And then I get the buzz (on my mobile cellular device): a text". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
